One of the first FPS I have played, and till today it has been a great way to bond with family and friends. However, like all games it too can make or brake bonds. Easily.

"With you we are five :)" - yeah, alright I'm in.
Join Teamspeak, everyone settles in.

Play a Map for a hundred times but can't see enemy due to new shit model and updated shaders. Doesn't matter, first game is always for warmup anyways. Lose 16:10 - not to bad.

Next Map. Our aim is true, one enemy doesn't play with sound. After 5 round one toxic enemy is kicked, another drops entirely out - receives 7 days ban. Win after surrender at 7:1 - not much fun but hey!

Next Map. We know the smokes, they do their best, but we hit them like a storm. Fumble a round - they are mad and counter rush. No problem we think. Half the team get's picked by one guy. Split and wait - no opening. Another smoke go - they've stacked the spot! Are they this lucky? Only the one guy is really good and carries the team. Our lead getting smaller. Half time, we're are on the defense. We Rotate to fast. Slow down, let's retake together.No avail, they can't throw nades to safe their lives, but somehow they are in the lead. Our last guy against three - and he pulls through. Full buy, this is it. The one guy decimates us - only headshots - and that's it, gg.
What is his rank? Fucking Silver? How long does he play? Oh. Steam level one, 100 hours on record.

The evening ends on a sour note, but tomorrow we'll get them!

Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.

Don't play it, it's to good to stop but you'll never be happy.

EDIT:
Now the worst community on the internet just randomly kicks people doing operation missions so they need to do it all over again.
